pages.text: Harpes is a Devonian trilobite known from various places across the world but primarily Morocco. It notably had reduced eyes and a semicircular shaped cephalon. The Harpetid brim had numerous small pores. The fringes of the brim are steeply inclined as it reaches the end of the body. Harpes also lacks a rostral plate and has a short sub-triangular pygidium
